verses.text: Hear ye this, O house of Jacob, Which are called by the name of Israel, And are come forth out of the waters of Judah, Which swear by the name of the \sc Lord\sc*, And make mention of the God of Israel, \add But\add* not in truth, nor in righteousness.
For they call themselves of the holy city, And stay themselves upon the God of Israel; The \sc Lord\sc* of hosts \add is\add* his name.
I have declared the former \add things\add* from the beginning; And they went forth out of my mouth, and I shewed them; I did \add them\add* suddenly, and they came to pass.
Because I knew that thou \add art\add* obstinate, And thy neck \add is\add* an iron sinew, And thy brow brass:

I have even from the beginning declared \add it\add* to thee; Before it came to pass I shewed \add it\add* thee: Lest thou shouldest say, Mine idol hath done them, And my graven image, and my molten image, hath commanded them.
Thou hast heard, see all this; And will not ye declare \add it?\add* I have shewed thee new \add things\add* from this time, Even hidden \add things\add*, and thou didst not know them.
They are created now, and not from the beginning; Even before the day when thou heardest them not; Lest thou shouldest say, Behold, I knew them.

Yea, thou heardest not; yea, thou knewest not; Yea, from that time \add that\add* thine ear was not opened: For I knew \add that\add* thou wouldest deal very treacherously, And wast called a transgressor from the womb.
For my nameâ€™s sake will I defer mine anger, And \add for\add* my praise will I refrain for thee, That \add I\add* cut thee not off.
Behold, I have refined thee, but not with silver; I have chosen thee in the furnace of affliction.
For mine own sake, \add even\add* for mine own sake, will I do \add it:\add* For how should \add my name\add* be polluted? And I will not give my glory unto another.
Hearken unto me, O Jacob, and Israel my called; I \add am\add* he; I \add am\add* the first, I also \add am\add* the last.
Mine hand also hath laid the foundation of the earth, And my right hand hath spanned the heavens: \add When\add* I call unto them, they stand \add up\add* together.

All ye, assemble yourselves, and hear; Which among them hath declared these \add things?\add* The \sc Lord\sc* hath loved him: He will do his pleasure on Babylon, And his arm \add shall be on\add* the Chaldeans.
I, \add even\add* I, have spoken; yea, I have called him: I have brought him, and he shall make his way prosperous.
Come ye near unto me, hear ye this; I have not spoken in secret from the beginning; From the time that it was, there \add am\add* I: And now the Lord \sc God\sc*, and his Spirit, hath sent me.

Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*, thy redeemer, the Holy One of Israel; I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc* thy God which teacheth thee to profit, Which leadeth thee by the way \add that\add* thou shouldest go.
O that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments! Then had thy peace been as a river, And thy righteousness as the waves of the sea:
Thy seed also had been as the sand, And the offspring of thy bowels like the gravel thereof; His name should not have been cut off nor destroyed from before me.

Go ye forth of Babylon, flee ye from the Chaldeans, With a voice of singing declare ye, tell this, Utter it \add even\add* to the end of the earth; Say ye, The \sc Lord\sc* hath redeemed his servant Jacob.
And they thirsted not \add when\add* he led them through the deserts: He caused the waters to flow out of the rock for them: He clave the rock also, and the waters gushed out.
\add There is\add* no peace, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, unto the wicked.
